citing_paper_authors: Changhua, Yang | Kevin Hsin-Yih, Lin | Hsin-Hsi, Chen
raw_text: In sentiment analysis research, Read (2005) used emoticons in newsgroup articles to extract instances relevant for training polarity classifiers
clean_text: In sentiment analysis research, Read (2005) used emoticons in newsgroup articles to extract instances relevant for training polarity classifiers.

raw_text: We therefore experiment with multiple such conventions with apparently similar meanings? here ,emoticons (following (Read, 2005)) and Twitter hash tags? allowing us to examine the similarity of classifiers trained on independent labels but intended to detect the same underlying class
clean_text: We therefore experiment with multiple such conventions with apparently similar meanings - here, emoticons (following (Read, 2005)) and Twitter hash tags - allowing us to examine the similarity of classifiers trained on independent labels but intended to detect the same underlying class.

raw_text: The regulating aspects of semantic orientation of a text are natural language context information (Pang et al, 2002 )language properties (Wiebe and Mihalcea, 2006), domain pragmatic knowledge (Aue and Gamon, 2005) and lastly most challenging is the time dimension (Read, 2005)
clean_text: The regulating aspects of semantic orientation of a text are natural language context information (Pang et al, 2002) language properties (Wiebe and Mihalcea, 2006), domain pragmatic knowledge (Aue and Gamon, 2005) and lastly most challenging is the time dimension (Read, 2005).

raw_text: We have built a corpus of tweets written in English following the procedure described in (Read, 2005) and (Go et al, 2009)

citing_paper_authors: M. Teresa, MartÃ¬n-Valdivia | Eugenio, MartÃ¬nez-CÃ¡mara | L. Alfonso, Urena-Lopez | Arturo, Montejo-Raez
raw_text: According to (Read, 2005), when authors of an electronic communication use an emotion, they are effectively marking up their own text with an emotional state
clean_text: According to (Read, 2005), when authors of an electronic communication use an emotion, they are effectively marking up their own text with an emotional state.

raw_text: The regulating aspects which govern the lexical level semantic orientation are natural language context (Pang et al, 2002), language properties (Wiebe and Mihalcea, 2006), domain pragmatic knowledge (Aue and Gamon, 2005), time dimension (Read, 2005), colors and culture (Strapparava and Ozbal, 2010) and many more unrevealed hidden aspects
clean_text: The regulating aspects which govern the lexical level semantic orientation are natural language context (Pang et al, 2002), language properties (Wiebe and Mihalcea, 2006), domain pragmatic knowledge (Aue and Gamon, 2005), time dimension (Read, 2005), colors and culture (Strapparava and Ozbal, 2010) and many more unrevealed hidden aspects.

citing_paper_authors: Michael, Speriosu | Nikita, Sudan | Sid, Upadhyay | Jason, Baldridge
raw_text: We seed the graph using the polarity values in the OpinionFinder lexicon (Wilson et al, 2005), the known polarity of emoticons, and a maximum entropy classifier trained on 1.8 million tweets with automatically assigned labels based on the presence of positive and negative emoticons, like Read (2005) and Go et al (2009)
clean_text: We seed the graph using the polarity values in the OpinionFinder lexicon (Wilson et al, 2005), the known polarity of emoticons, and a maximum entropy classifier trained on 1.8 million tweets with automatically assigned labels based on the presence of positive and negative emoticons, like Read (2005) and Go et al (2009).

raw_text: The regulating aspects which govern the lexical level semantic orientation are natural language context (Pang et al, 2002), language properties (Wiebe and Mihalcea, 2006), domain pragmatic knowledge (Aue and Gamon, 2005), time dimension (Read, 2005), colors and culture (Strapparava and Ozbal, 2010) and many more unrevealed hid den aspects

raw_text: It is not a static sentiment lexicon set [polarity changes with time (Read, 2005)] as it is updated regularly
clean_text: It is not a static sentiment lexicon set [polarity changes with time (Read, 2005)] as it is updated regularly.

raw_text: We use emoticons2 as indicators of an emotion (Read, 2005) to automatically classify texts into positive or negative sets
